results.title: Metformin impairs trophoblast metabolism and differentiation in a dose-dependent manner

results.title: Mitochondrial encephalopathy, lactic acidosis, and stroke-like episodes diagnosed after metformin-triggered stroke-like episodes.
results.text_hl: Thus, we encourage physicians to exercise caution in the prescription of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Growth_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006130 @@@short stature@@@, @DISEASE_Hearing_Loss_Sensorineural @DISEASE_MESH:D006319 @@@sensorineural hearing loss@@@, or young-onset @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetes mellitus@@@ because these @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ may have undiagnosed @DISEASE_Mitochondrial_encephalopathy @DISEASE_MESH:C538525 @@@mitochondrial encephalopathy@@@, @DISEASE_Acidosis_Lactic @DISEASE_MESH:D000140 @@@lactic acidosis@@@, and @DISEASE_Stroke @DISEASE_MESH:D020521 @@@stroke@@@-like episodes.

citations.NLM: Murakami K, Sakamoto K, Ishiguchi H, Ito H. Mitochondrial encephalopathy, lactic acidosis, and stroke-like episodes diagnosed after metformin-triggered stroke-like episodes. J Stroke Cerebrovasc Dis. 2023 May;32(5):107080. PMID: 36933522

results.title: SHORT syndrome in two Chinese girls: A case report and review of the literature
results.text_hl: She was first seen in the endocrine clinic at age 14.5 years and was referred for the assessment of @<m>DISEASE_Growth_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006130 @@@short stature@@@.

results.title: Novel PIK3R1 mutation of SHORT syndrome: A case report with a 6-month follow up
results.text_hl: Treatment plans, including lifestyle intervention combined with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Pioglitazone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077205 @@@pioglitazone@@@, were carried out.

results.title: INSR novel mutations identified in a Chinese family with severe INSR-related insulin resistance syndromes: A case report
results.text_hl: The @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@ was prescribed @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ (250 mg) at breakfast and lunch, which was increased to 500 mg after 1 month.

results.title: Neutrophil count in small-for-gestational age children: contrasting effects of metformin and growth hormone therapy.
results.text_hl: A minority of children born small for gestational age (SGA) maintain a slow @DISEASE_Weight_Gain @DISEASE_MESH:D015430 @@@weight gain@@@ and a @<m>DISEASE_Growth_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006130 @@@short stature@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Growth_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006130 @@@SS@@@).

results.title: Polycystic kidney disease: a case of suppressed autophagy?
results.text_hl: Many of the agents that inhibit these signaling pathways and slow @<m>DISEASE_Growth_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006130 @@@cyst growth@@@ are also autophagy inducers such as @GENE_MTOR @GENE_2475 @@@mammalian target of rapamycin@@@ inhibitors, cyclin-dependent kinase inhibitors, caspase inhibitors, @GENE_TXK @GENE_7294 @@@tyrosine kinase@@@ inhibitors, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, @CHEMICAL_Curcumin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D003474 @@@curcumin@@@, and @CHEMICAL_triptolide @CHEMICAL_MESH:C001899 @@@triptolide@@@.

citations.NLM: Ravichandran K, Edelstein CL. Polycystic kidney disease: a case of suppressed autophagy? Semin Nephrol. 2014 Jan;34(1):27-33. PMID: 24485027
